intro: Savia membranacea, commonly known as the membranous savia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
